intro: Palicourea lechleri, commonly known as sangre de drago, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, including alkaloids and flavonoids. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
